tool_description: National Weather Service API (api.weather.gov) NOAA (National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration) provides national weather data as well as past data.
name: National Weather Service
title: National Weather Service

api_list.name: /zones/{type}/{zoneId}/forecast
api_list.description: Forecast data for zone. Example: /zones/forecast/MOZ028/forecast

required_parameters.name: type
required_parameters.description: type: a valid zone type (list forthcoming)

required_parameters.name: zoneId
required_parameters.description: zoneId: a zone id (list forthcoming)

api_list.name: /products/types/{typeId}/locations/{locationId}
api_list.description: A product for a location that has issued a product for a specific type.  Example: /products/types/AFD/locations/EAX

required_parameters.name: locationId
required_parameters.description: locationId: an id of a valid location (list forthcoming)

required_parameters.name: typeId
required_parameters.description: typeId: an id of a valid product type

api_list.name: /products/types/{typeId}
api_list.description: A list of products by type. Example: /products/types/AFD

required_parameters.name: typeId
required_parameters.description: typeId: an id of a valid product type

api_list.name: /points/{point}/forecast/hourly
api_list.description: Hourly forecast data for a point. This response is derrived from the /gridpoints endpoint and is intentionally less structured. If more structure is required, developers should use the /gridpoints endpoint directly. Example: /points/39.0693,-94.6716/forecast/hourly

required_parameters.name: point
required_parameters.description: point: EPSG:4326 latitude, EPSG:4326 longitude

api_list.name: /gridpoints/{wfo}/{x},{y}
api_list.description: Raw (commonly referred to as "gridded") data provided by the Weather Office. Every forecast request will use this data to build the forecast response. The grid for a given location is determined by the "property.forecastGridData" property in the /points/{lat},{lon} endpoint. Example: /gridpoints/EAX/40,48

required_parameters.name: wfo
required_parameters.description: wfo: a weather office id (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_National_Weather_Service_Weather_Forecast_Offices)

required_parameters.name: x
required_parameters.description: x: the grid x coordinate

required_parameters.name: y
required_parameters.description: y: the grid y coordinate

api_list.name: /alerts/active/zone/{zoneId}
api_list.description: A list of active alerts by zone id. The ATOM format returns items in CAP-ATOM. Example: /alerts/active/zone/ILZ081

required_parameters.name: zoneId
required_parameters.description: zoneId: a valid zone, see list in counts endpoint

api_list.name: /products/{productId}
api_list.description: Data of a product.Example: /product/NWS-IDP-PROD-2202326-2064512 (this id is likely now an expired product)

required_parameters.name: productId
required_parameters.description: productId: an id provided by from another /product endpoint

api_list.name: /stations/{stationId}/observations
api_list.description: A list of observations for a station.  NOTE! The API uses MADIS to provide observation data. The observation may be delayed while MADIS completes quality checks of the data. To limit the delay, the API is provided with incremental updates with various levels of checked data, and the API will return the variation of the observation with the most checked data. It is possible that no data is provided on the first variation, or that no data is checked on the first variation. It is up to the consumer to determine if the quality of data is appropriate. If not, the previous observation can be requested, or the next nearest station can be used. The API returns the state of the data for each value in the response, where "Z" (or "null") is for not checked (and may never be for some values) and "V" for checked. Please refer to MADIS for complete documentation on their data quality process.  Example: /stations/KMKC/observations

required_parameters.name: stationId
required_parameters.description: stationId: a valid station id (e.g. as provided by the /points/{point}/stations endpoint)

api_list.name: /products/types
api_list.description: A list of product types with an active product
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://national-weather-service.p.rapidapi.com/products/types"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "national-weather-service.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
api_list.convert_code:
import requests

url = "https://national-weather-service.p.rapidapi.com/products/types"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "national-weather-service.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: /points/{point}/stations
api_list.description: Stations nearest to a point in order of distance. Example: /points/39.0693,-94.6716/stations

required_parameters.name: point
required_parameters.description: point: EPSG:4326 latitude, EPSG:4326 longitude

api_list.name: /alerts/{alertId}
api_list.description: A specific alert by id provided by a search or list. Example: /alerts/NWS-IDP-PROD-2202530-2064731

api_list.name: /alerts/active/count
api_list.description: A list of active counts for regions, areas and zones. A list of these items forthcoming.

api_list.name: /products/locations
api_list.description: A list of locations with active products.

api_list.name: /alerts/active
api_list.description: A list of active alerts that can be filtered by parameters. Uses same parameters as the /alerts endpoint, but sets "active" parameter to 1 and ignores "start" and "end" parameters. The ATOM format returns items in CAP-ATOM.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://national-weather-service.p.rapidapi.com/alerts/active"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "national-weather-service.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

print(response.json())

api_list.name: /zones/{type}/{zoneId}
api_list.description: Metadata for a zone. Example /zones/forecast/MOZ028

required_parameters.name: type
required_parameters.description: type: a valid zone type (list forthcoming)

required_parameters.name: zoneId
required_parameters.description: zoneId: a zone id (list forthcoming)

api_list.name: /alerts/active/area/{area}
api_list.description: A list of active alerts by area. The ATOM format returns items in CAP-ATOM.

required_parameters.name: area
required_parameters.description: area: a valid area, see list in counts endpoint

api_list.name: /points/{point}/forecast
api_list.description: Forecast data for a point. The DWML format is a temporary format to aid transition and will be sunset at a later date. This response is derrived from the /gridpoints endpoint and is intentionally less structured. If more structure is required, developers should use the /gridpoints endpoint directly. Example: /points/39.0693,-94.6716/forecast

required_parameters.name: point
required_parameters.description: point: EPSG:4326 latitude, EPSG:4326 longitude

api_list.name: /products/locations/{locationId}/types
api_list.description: Metadata about a Weather Office. Example /offices/EAX

required_parameters.name: locationId
required_parameters.description: officeId: a weather office id (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_National_Weather_Service_Weather_Forecast_Offices)

api_list.name: /stations/{stationId}/observations/{recordId}
api_list.description: Data for a specific observation.  NOTE! See note in /stations/{stationId}/observations for important details on observation data.  Example: /stations/KMKC/observations/2017-01-04T18:54:00+00:00

required_parameters.name: stationId
required_parameters.description: stationsId: Station id

required_parameters.name: recordId
required_parameters.description: recordId, Record Id (ISO8601DateTime)

api_list.name: /stations
api_list.description: A list of stations and station metadata that can be filtered by parameters. If no parameters are provided, then all stations are returned. This list is not configured by field offices and only returns active stations. Example: /stations?limit=10&states=KS,MO

api_list.name: /alerts?{parameters}
api_list.description: A list of alerts that can be filtered by parameters. If no parameters are provided, then all alerts are returned. The ATOM format returns items in CAP-ATOM.

optional_parameters.name: zone
optional_parameters.description: zone, Zone Id (forecast or county, list forthcoming)

api_list.name: /alerts/active/region/{region}
api_list.description: A list of active alerts by region. The ATOM format returns items in CAP-ATOM. Example: /alerts/active/region/GL

required_parameters.name: region
required_parameters.description: area: a valid region, see list in counts endpoint

api_list.name: /points/{point}
api_list.description: Metadata about a point. This is the primary endpoint for forecast information for a location. It contains linked data for the forecast, the hourly forecast, observation and other information. Example: /points/39.0693,-94.6716

required_parameters.name: point
required_parameters.description: point: EPSG:4326 latitude, EPSG:4326 longitude

api_list.name: /products/types/{typeId}/locations
api_list.description: A list of locations that have issues products for a type. Example: /products/types/AFD/locations

required_parameters.name: typeId
required_parameters.description: typeId: an id of a valid product type (list forthcoming)

api_list.name: /stations/{stationId}/observations/current
api_list.description: The most current observation for a station. Due to a legacy requirement, this endpoint will support XML for the near future when using the Accept header. It is highly recommend that applications update to the JSON format.  NOTE! See note in /stations/{stationId}/observations for important details on observation data.  Example: /stations/KMKC/observations/current

required_parameters.name: stationId
required_parameters.description: stationId: Station Id (e.g. as provided by the /points/{point}/stations endpoint)

api_list.name: /stations/{stationId}
api_list.description: Metadata about a station. Similar to /stations endpoint with id parameter. Example: /stations/KMKC

required_parameters.name: stationId
required_parameters.description: stationId: the id of a station from the /points/{point}/stations endpoint
